> We think that the crawl configuration is important enough to deposit
> into our preservation repository along with its associated harvest so
> we have recently developed a mets profile for web harvests that embeds
> the order.xml within it. We also have a lot of related code, etc.
> built to create and work with these.  The existing schema for the
> order.xml works well enough for our needs to be able to validate the
> order.xml file. With the sheets way of configuration is there a way to
> serialize the configuration to a file?

Well, sheets are just plain text files. The global.sheet file is  
basically the same as order.xml.

Were you including override settings in your preservation repository?  
Overrides are stored in a BDB in 2.0, so that might cause some  
difficulties for you.

> And can we generate the
> configuration without using the web interface?

Yes. The web interface uses JMX to control Heritrix; you can use  
tools like jconsole to control Heritrix, or write your own Java  
programs to control it. Ideally there'd be an easy way to send JMX  
messages to Heritrix without needing Java; see my latest message to  
Erik Hetzner for ideas there.

Again, the sheets are plain text files, so you can also write them by  
hand or use a script to generate them.

> My other concern with heritrix 2.0 is that hcc is incompatible with
> it. How incompatible? Is this just in the short-term or is  hcc being
> phased out?

See my most recent message to Daniel Clark. In summary: Yes, we  
definitely plan to support hcc or integrate hcc-like features  
directly in the engine; no, we don't have a timeframe for that yet.

> thanks,
> Andrea

Thanks for the feedback!

-Paul
